author: {'steamid': '76561198140418725', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1622368618}
review:
Bei den Entwicklern scheint es gravierende Mängel in Sachen Snooker-Regeln zu geben. Physikalisches Wissen oder die Umsetzung dessen ist auch eher mangelhaft.

Es kostet zwar nicht viel, aber Spaß kommt bei diesem Spiel nicht auf.

author: {'steamid': '76561199020906572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1694970059}
review: Excellent HD graphics and physics. This game also has full support for whichever controller you prefer - mouse, trackball, or gamepad. I personally use a trackball and had no issues setting up or taking shots. Although the game allows you take shots by pushing forward with a mouse, It also allows an option to shoot with the click of a button.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051517179', 'num_games_owned': 2832, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1675699045}
review:
Great Pool game. I have one other Pool game in my library - which WAS also good (had the potential to be great) - but was abandoned by the developer (which released a second game WAY too soon to win my support again). This game however, the developers are supporting their product and still actively engage with the community regarding features and bugs/glitches.

I can definitely recommend this great game. (I have not tried playing against human opponents in online games - but I am really enjoying the Bar Championship)

author: {'steamid': '76561198339767443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1689549410}
review: Jogo simples e divertido, várias modalidades de jogo, com opção até 4 jogadores locais ou multi jogador online, e ainda tem bastante personalização entre tacos, bolas e mesas, bem completo vale a pena jogar!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973713576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1704315921}
review: Das beste Pool. Hatte erst die großen, also Pool Nation, Pool Nation FX und Pure Pool. So schön Pure Pool auch aussieht... das Menü ist... hat das von den Entwicklern mal einer überprüft? Nation FX sieht irgendwie nicht so gut aus. Und Nation ist zwar optisch ne Augenweite, aber dieser "Zwang" zu besonders Actionreichen Stößen nervt auf dauer gewaltig. Und dann kommt dieses kleine Cue Club daher. Tischgröße anpassbar! Das ist Soooo ein großer Punkt. Das selbe Spiel spielt sich auf einem 6er gaaanz anders als auf nem 9ner.  Die Regeln sind anpassbar. 2D und 3D in einem, beides wird auch heute noch ständig mit Patches verbessert. Alles ist irgendwie einstellbar. Und das Spiel braucht keine Mausakrobatik, man wählt vorm Stoß alles genauestens aus. Es ist einfach die Bombe unter den Billiardspielen. Selbst Snooker ist enthalten. Alle anderen Spiele hab ich deinstalliert. Außer Poolians Billiard 3d. Einfach weil ich auch gerne mal einfach nur Zuschaue. :) Von mir gaaaanz klare Kaufempfehlung, das Beste Billiard weit und breit, nur mit leichten grafischen Abstrichen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969393212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 27988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4410, 'last_played': 1701209243}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198407043944', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1712153559}
review: 小时候就开始玩一代，印象很深，一代至少玩了500小时。二代和一代相比相差很大。二代不适合用鼠标键盘，适合用手柄玩。3D模式很僵硬，不如手机版本的3D桌球。2D还是不错的，球的击打效果非常丝滑。AI比较有挑战性，就是解球的时候脑子不好使，第一次解不到就永远也解不到了。掌声和欢呼的效果很好，单人游戏时玩的很舒服，音乐也很棒。虽然仍有很多缺点，但也很难找到比这个更好的台球类游戏了。

author: {'steamid': '76561197973259706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1579640217}

review:
mise à jour répétitives pour pas grand chose,les coups sauvegardés sont mal enregistrés puisque à la relecture plus aucune boule ne rentre comme ça s'est passé,peu de choix de couleurs de boules.Avec toutes ses mise à jours il pourrait y avoir plus de changement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198986934380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2577, 'last_played': 1697561136}
review: A fantastic billiards simulator, if you have played a'lot of Pool & Snooker in real life you will notice that the physics for the rebound shots off the cushions is a little off, just a wee bit tight in my opinion. Other than that it is an excellent game, played 42 hours so far and I think it is a fair substitute for playing on a real table, highly recommended!

review: Pot as many Balls as you can.  Multiplayer seems quite bugged at the moment, hopefully will be fixed.  Its a fun Pool and Snooker game though. As of June 2021 Multiplayer seems better, but still a time delay when waiting for opponent to take a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326433399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1702673852}
review: Cue Club 2 and Virtual Pool 4 are my favorite titles for Billiards.  Both titles have some very strong positives. I like the many options in Cue Club 2. I am also very impressed that the developers continue to update the game for players. I would like to see the removal of the cartoon style players. The women need to be dressed in a more modest way for the younger players of the game. Playing against an Ape and a Robot really takes away from the experience.  The many table options and rooms are a real positive.  I would like to see some additional ball designs in the future.  I again praise the developers for their continued support of this great title!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011633154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 9131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2048, 'last_played': 1710451868}
review:
Habe nun schon einige Pool Games durch, aber dieses Billard Spiel gefällt mir bisher am besten! 
Die Physik passt einfach und ist glaubwürdig.  
Ausserdem gibt es sehr viel Einstellungsmöglichkeiten. Größe des Tisches, Bälle und Cues. Farbe der Bespannung und Taschen. Man kann sogar die Linien der Tische anpassen!  
Es gibt natürlich auch noch verschiedene Designs der Bälle und Cues. 
Gibts Fragen oder Probleme zum Game, kommt ziemlich schnell eine Antwort vom Entwickler. 
Updates? Fast Wöchentlich!

review: AI is far too good, particularly on Novice setting.  It should have a much higher miss rate than what it has.
developer_response: Hi, if you go to 'Options > Match Settings' there are menus for Bar Challenge and Tournament, go in here and adjust difficulty down to Novice or Amateur, this should help. For Quick Matches there are 5 difficulty levels from Novice to Pro, but we will look at adding further controls here to give a broader range of settings. Thanks for the feedback.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010390977', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1561123035}
review:
Worked well for first session. 24 hours later it is unplayable with constant crashes and unresponsive dialogs.

Refund request refused due 4 hour play time.
developer_response: Sorry to hear you've had this issue. We'd like to help you get the game running smoothly. Please can you reach out to us at support@cueclub.com with details of what happened and our team will do our best to assist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198425030256', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1551945525}
review: 很棒的台球游戏，之前原本想白嫖一下的（两个小时内退款~滑稽），一玩之后就上瘾了，碰撞感和打击感很棒，进洞的声音令人身临其境，我玩了下破解版的pure pool和台球国度感觉很硬核，这款游戏操作和上手度对新手很友好，视角也很棒有2d和3d，不错的休闲游戏~

author: {'steamid': '76561198428624159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1698516906}
review:
It's a good arcade pool game, great to pass the time and knock a few balls around, however, there's still room for improvements, like adding 14.1 continuous (Straight Pool) or even carom billiards, adding more locations, snooker cues, jump shots, having the option to play 'race to...' frames not just 'best of'. There's also some bugs like when using the aiming aid and a few more. The 3D camera should be more flexible and not fixed close to the cue ball, it's difficult to aim in 3D sometimes. It would be great to skip the AI shots too. The physics are questionable at times.

EDIT 1: I have encountered a bug in which a potted ball is the 'on' ball, it's fixed by restarting the match. 
EDIT 2: It crashed when I enabled the music, the game had started on mute.
EDIT 3: The pocket/jaw physics are abysmal, if it's not straight in, it's a miss! Please fix them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198101446609', 'num_games_owned': 1796, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 9977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 14, 'playtime_at_review': 3721, 'last_played': 1711305850}
review:
Sin duda el mejor juego para quienes aman el pool y/o el snooker
En cuanto a la jugabilidad no tengo quejas esta muy pulido y presenta una amplia cantidad de modos de juego que desprenden del pool y el snooker, con las reglas reales de juego muy bien definidas y con la posibilidad de personalizar algunas de estas. Ademas se actualiza constantemente, los desarrolladores estan pendientes del juego.
Muy recomendado sin nesesidad de esperar a las ofertas para comprarlo, vale la pena el precio, lo único malo es que no hay mucha gente en el multijugador pero es de esperarse en este tipo de juegos.

Eso si, si alguno es obsesivo con los logros, amenos que sea un experto en el snooker no compre el juego o va a sufrir mucho con el Break 147 se lo puedo asegurar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152760885', 'num_games_owned': 17519, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1533239243}
review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
This shall be my second review for a simulation of cue sports. Colloquially refered to as “billiards”, we can all agree that it’s an activity which still poses great interest even after more than five centuries since its invention. There may be at least a dozen online alternatives to Cue Club 2, yet few offer as much customization as the title I’m reviewing today. It is Bulldog Interactive’s Steam debut and their project has certainly improved substantially over time. You might be wandering about Cue Club 1 at this point. This particular developer has focused on cue sport simulations since 2000, which is almost as long as I’ve been gaming on PC. Cue Club 2 saw an initial retail release in 2014 and it has graced the Steam Store since 2016. If you’re good at something, never stop improving it. Or do it for free, since I’m certain that you’ve stumbled across plenty of F2Ps featuring billiards and snooker. They were rather thin on content, am I right?

[h1]Story[/h1]
Now, I could bore you with more historical details about cue sports, but I shall obviously avoid that path. Cue Club 2 has no story mode per se, yet the Bar Challenge can be considered a solo campaign designed specifically for players which do not wish to sink their teeth too deep into multiplayer that's ranging from championships to casual matches. Before discussing the Challenge, let me share my own experience with billiard simulations. Long before I enjoyed the activity in real life, I developed a taste for it in it’s digital format on PCs. There may have been several self-standing games based on pool, which I played earlier to some extent but quite surprisingly, it would be the Grand Theft Auto series (San Andreas, precisely) which managed to prove how fun and lucrative this activity can be. A visit to the Ten Green Bottles would both relax and allow for a friendly wager (crucial funds during a fresh start).

The sheer versatility of cue sports cemented their reputation as a favorite pastime of both blue and white collars. From watering holes in the middle of nowhere to pretentious social clubs, billiards receive the appreciation they deserve. Cue Club 2’s Bar Challenge is divided into three sections of gradually increasing difficulty: Basement, Cocktail and Penthouse. Three bars filled to the brim with worthy opponents. We get the usual assortment of skilled female and male players, but also more exotic rivals such a talented ape and a robot. Let no one claim that pool titles can’t mix some humor into the already established formula. In fact, the AI of your opponents will ensure that the Bar Challenge lives up to its name. It won’t be easy and it proves to be the perfect tutorial/warm up for the subsequent modes. As good a replacement for a story as you could hope for, given the gameplay. No cheesy cutscenes in Cue Club 2.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
I couldn’t find any information about the graphics engine, so we’ll proceed with the default assumption that it is proprietary to the developer. A hybrid 2D/3D perspective is a feature that we’ve all come to expect from contemporary cue sports simulations. Cue Club 2 does not disappoint on this front whatsoever. Depending on your preferences, you can enjoy the game in either 2D top-down view or fully rendered in 3D and far closer to the real life experience. I’m obviously a fan of the latter, since the former can make the game somewhat easier than intended. We’re not cheating on the Bar Challenge, fellas. Speaking of which, ball trajectory estimations will fully cater to new players. You don’t have to fear being left completely helpless, if your pool skills are rusty or non-existent.

As far as performance was concerned, I have no complaints. Everything scaled perfectly to 4K resolution and the frame rate never dropped below 60fps at any given moment. The aforementioned rich customization options come into play during the breaks between matches (not during ongoing championships though). I strongly suggest you fiddle with the settings menu and discover for yourselves, exactly how much you can tweak the experience. From changing the appearance of tables, cues and ball sets, to modifying the rules which shall govern the matches and ultimately ensure or hinder victory. European Pool doesn’t have to be much more complicated than the streamlined American version, which is also my personal favorite. Don’t even get me started about Snooker!

[h1]Audio[/h1]
Indeed, there’s no voice acting in Cue Club 2 but the soundtrack manages to compensate that, while text boxes represent the only interaction between players and the rivals you’ll have to defeat during your playthrough. Song diversity is balanced. It never got too close to repetitiveness since I was more focused on the game than on the sounds. You can always opt for listening to your own tracks of choice, so no cause of concern over acoustical inadequacies.

 [h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The bread and butter of any cue sport simulation will always be represented by the versatility of its various modes. It would have been far too simplistic to slap a US, Euro or Snooker label and call it a day. Bulldog Interactive offers some much needed variations: Killer Pool, Red Snooker and the “rapid fire” 6 Ball Pool which I compare to Blitz Chess in terms of duration and challenge. The standard pool game on both sides of the Atlantic, contains 15 balls (stripes and solids/spots) and a cue ball that’s usually blank or featuring a dot pattern. Snooker on the other hand, uses 22 colored balls along with a cue ball and can drag on for longer than I’m comfortable with. It’s always a matter of preference and Cue Club 2 offers either the standard or tailored versions which may speed up the process to a certain extent. Cutting corners quite literally, since table customization enables several pocket designs.

One key aspect I always seek out when analyzing cue sport simulations, is the Artificial Intelligence’s capabilities even on lower difficulty settings. Multiplayer matches and human minds are more difficult to predict and mistakes are rarely made on a consistent basis if you’re playing with someone skilled enough. How about the AI in a pool game? I judge their competence or the lack thereof, by observing the involuntary early pocketing of the 8-ball. That is the “cardinal sin” of any cue sport afterall. It spells “game over” and an easy, albeit somewhat undeserved victory for an opponent that might have fared badly in terms of pocketed balls. Out of turn pocketing is more lenient for stripes & solids but not for the “dreaded” eight-ball. Cue Club 2 surprised me by how rarely would the AI commit such an error. The Bar Challenge proved to be a worthy experience and I had my share of defeats against an AI which calculated both the approach angle and strike strength with alarming alacrity. 

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
Overall, Cue Club 2 distances itself from its competition by giving players some much needed freedom for the rule sets as well. Custom profiles that transcend mere chromatic choices, offer flexibility to an otherwise rigid sport and pastime activity. It was only natural to allow billiards their chance of adapting to the audience, since the real life version has managed that quite admirably. Whether you play pool in a roadside bar or in a downtown club, the game depends on more than just a steady hand and a clear mind. It takes plenty of creativity and patience. Enjoy a cold pint and only pocket the 8-ball at its right time!

 [h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Steam Achievements.
+ Adequate challenge scaling.
+ Pleasant graphics and soundtrack.
+ Excellent simulation with replay value.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Inherent repetitiveness of the gameplay.
- No Steam Trading Cards.

[b]Rating 80/100[/b]

[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews]Imperial Reviews[/url] through the generous contribution of the game’s developer and the Steam Curator Connect program.[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198097675823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1578716491}
review:
Cue Club 2 is a sim game, this is the best pool game I have played so far, I don't play pool games it in the classic view in 3d, and most of the pool simulator games only offers this perspective and that makes me very sad, but this one not only have top down view and 3d view, but also have this epic crosshair that makes aiming the balls so much more better, you know I know simulators try to make their games realistic but they should learn that gameplay is always above realistic, in the end sim games are also games, they are supose to be fun even being realistic, that is why cue club 2 is for now my favorite pool game, its expensive but worth it every cent.

+arcade infinite replay value
+amazing soundtrack
+outstanding graphics
+nice main menu

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198114187903', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1528755931}
review:
Cons:
1. Too many Technical Bugs. e.g sometimes when the AI is snookered the game comes to a halt and nothing happens at all. You have to restart the match. Also saving a game is quite often buggy and is unreliable.
2. Awkward bad physics and things happen that shouldn't in reality.
3. Poor AI. AI plays like no human player ever should or would.
4. Poor customization options e.g Before making a shot you adjust the power of the shot. The game helps you by already predifining the power of the shot to a default power, which is too excessive. Now everytime i play the shot i have to bring down the power. And there is no option in-game which would let me choose my own default power.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304921862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 678, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1712338936}
review:
There is everything to like about this game. I have owned the first version of it for twenty years. Loved playing it so much after a long day, while resting in bed and unwinding by playing it. It is so much fun.

I played this latest version too for a few hours but then it started crashing. Maybe an update would fix that. Still, I highly recommend it. After having owned this game, you would never feel the need to dress up and go to the nearest pool or snooker club. You would have all you need right in the comfort of your home.

Five stars. 10/10. Thank you Bulldog Interactive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007704150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1705176877}
review: Note this is an updated review after around 24 hours of gameplay: This is an excellent pool and snooker game. There are legions of options, a number of billiards variants to play, various competitive setups available, and it's loads of fun. Note: this game includes UK pool and amazingly 7-ball! (Never seen the latter anywhere else). I won't labour the point too long, I just urge you to give it a go, and for the price, it's a steal. The physics are also pretty realistic. Snooker is in my view well implemented, and this must be especially tricky to get right. The look and feel of the game is attractive and professionally done. The game even features a live audience, complete with applause, cheering and gasps! Now for some suggestions for further improvements (the British devs are constantly refining the game, they're among the most responsive devs I've ever seen!). Spin play needs improving – especially screwback is not ideally implemented and spin in general could be refined. A career mode would be a huge bonus. Some controls are occasionally a bit clunky. The AI is generally good and plays a solid game, but it doesn't always take the best chances, e.g. it will not try to knock in a money ball hanging over the pocket using a plant (the AI in Virtual Pool 4 will do this). At present, the AI is an aggressive (and highly competent!) potter, and is skilled at escaping snookers, but does lack in some other facets of play, e.g. laying snookers, and playing safeties, plants, and doubles. A further suggestion: once you've beaten all the AIs on Bar Tournament at any level, that's it, you've unlocked all the AIs for all the variants. But wouldn't it be better to make the player beat every AI for every billiards variant and at every difficulty, and not just one? Multiplayer exists but currently is not well implemented and needs some work. The devs are working hard on an ongoing basis to make this super product even better. Overall: great game, loving it, well done devs!

review: Game looks pretty but the controls are odd. i don't feel like it's playing pool it feels like i'm firing a cannon. further more the multiplayer doesn't work. for starters, you send a game invite and once your friend accepts, it sends you an invite which you then need to accept. wot?  but besides that, what my friend sees happening on his table is not what i see on my table (and the game crashes)  In 20mins of play we attempted 2 games, both of which crashed after the first or second shot.  this is one of the worst games i have ever experienced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029003787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1529152822}
review:
Bonjour,

Je ne recommande pas ce jeu ! Sauf si vous voulez investir 18 € dans un jeu de merde !
Plantage a répétition ; Impossible de lancer une partie de snooker
developer_response:
Bonjour Yorgi,

Désolé d'avoir entendu parler de ce problème. Nous avons téléchargé une nouvelle mise à jour aujourd'hui, qui, espérons-le, corrige le problème. Accédez à l'application Steam, faites un clic droit sur Cue Club 2, puis sélectionnez 'propriétés > fichiers locaux > vérifier l'intégrité des fichiers de jeu'.

S'il vous plaît contactez-nous au support@cueclub.com si vous avez besoin de plus d'aide. Je vous remercie.

-----

Sorry to hear about this issue. We have uploaded a new update today, that hopefully fixes the problem. Go to the Steam app, right click on Cue Club 2, then select 'properties > local files > verify integrity of game files'.

Please contact us at support@cueclub.com if you need more assistance. Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047578983', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4671, 'last_played': 1706951975}

author: {'steamid': '76561198182533763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1300, 'last_played': 1657542668}
review:
Очень хороший бильярд, ничего лишнего! Приятное музыкальное сопровождение. Разные виды бильярда, семь видов пула, три вида снукера. Я в снукер играть не умею, так что ничего про него сказать не могу, а вот пул выполнен прекрасно.  Реалистичная физика шаров. Отзывчивый разработчик. В случае выявления каких то багов, реагирует быстро. К примеру, вчера попытался поиграть с другом в мультиплеере. Кликаю на мультиплеер, меня выкидывает из игры, перезапускаю, такая же фигня. Описываю проблему разработчику, он связывается со мной, выявляем баг и сегодня выходит багфикс и вуаля, мультиплеер работает!!!   Сыграть после работы несколько матчей под ненадоедливую музыку, самое то!!! И кстати, приятный факт. В обозримом будущем разработчик обещает добавить в игру «Русский Бильярд». Надеемся и ждём. Кому интересно, об этом можно прочитать в обсуждениях. Вот ссыль http://steamcommunity.com/app/366690/discussions/0/1692659769960751698/
Ну и о том, рекомендую или нет? Конечно рекомендую!!! Я купил себе пять бильярдов в стиме на распродаже! За четыре вернул деньги, а в этот играю до сих пор! И даже купил еще трём своим друзьям)))
Так что приятной игры! Если ценник кусается, дождитесь распродажи!  10 приятно проведенных игровых вечеров из 10!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198271260907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 85496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1593427282}
review:
如果说steam上最好的平面台球是哪一款，我绝对会承认是《台球俱乐部2》。非常适合在闲暇时间来上一盘。

不过steam上物理模拟效果最好的台球，还是virtual pool 4，这也是steam上台球玩家公认的。虽然cue club2一直在开发3D模式，不过手感上也只是2D模式的“魔改”版。

另外关于不能窗口化的问题，只需要在桌面快方式中右键属性，在“目标”地址后面加上下面一段文字即可。
[code] -w1600 -h900[/code]

另外我十分佩服的一点就是这款游戏的开发者一直在更新，而且十分频繁。没有理由不给好评

author: {'steamid': '76561198333648318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 79108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26050, 'last_played': 1710272058}
review: Why my name is not showing in the game board when I play?
developer_response: Hi, first check you are logged in correctly. From the CC2 main menu, go to Startup > Login and enter your name. To qualify for online speed pool and snooker break leaderboards, then please ensure you have secondary aiming lines turned off in 2D and 3D. See Options > Dynamics > Guiding Lines. I hope something here helps?

author: {'steamid': '76561198143926282', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1514503471}
review:
Tanti ricordi mi affiorano alla mente ripensando al primo cue club, storico gioco!
Purtroppo il due è uno dei tanti giochi sul biliardo. Ben fatto sia in grafica che in giocabilità, ma la caratteristica delle sale con la finta chat e la possibilità di farti strada e diventare il RE del biliardo è stata ridotta ad un semplice "scala la classifica" come si può trovare in tutti i giochi.
Peccato davvero, credevo che quell'aspetto fosse stato riproposto e in veste migliorata e invece delusione.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052338670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1635243436}
review:
I was looking for a snooker game that would entertain me as much as Jimmy White's Whirlwind Snooker on the Amiga did in the past. There are many billards and snookers on Steam and I have most of them.

Cue Club 2 may not be the eye candy that other titles are, but at least CC2 works(!), is a lot of fun and the developers are still improving it. From the 560+ games I have in my account, this is the most constantly updated game - not because it needs fixes all the time, but because the developers really care about their product and customers.

The game never had any serious bugs since release and only got better with the developers actually listening to the players. You won't find this with any other billard simulation on Steam. There are many abandoned beta versions out there waiting to eat your money and flush it down the toilet. Cue Club 2 is worth every cent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992824915', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 5140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1705252304}
review:

Consigliato, anche perché la rigiocabilità è praticamente infinita e il supporto costante!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061955229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1625895075}
review:
hey, When I am playing the game; its getting closed automatically. I dont know whats wrong but the application is not responding properly while playing the game and also I did not set the 3D mode to ON but whenever I start a game its getting into the 3D mode by itself. 

Please check this issue immediately...!!! its really irritating.
developer_response:
Hi. Sorry to hear you've had a few issues. First, make sure that if you have AV software that it is not flagging a 'false positive' and blocking the game. In the AV settings create a whitelist to the EXE located at C:/Program Files (x86)/Steam/SteamApps/common/Cue Club 2/cueclub2.exe.

Regarding 3D, you might need to reset all preferences. In the CC2 main menu select Options > File Management > Delete Saved Data > Game Settings. Hopefully this will help, but please feel free to reach out to us at support@cueclub.com if you need more assistance. Thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171870014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 13551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1700426854}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018459751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1887, 'last_played': 1664088415}
review:
For anyone who has ever played the original Cue Club game you would most likely have bought this as soon as you saw it on steam. The game is being actively updated and the developers truly listen to suggestions. "I gave a suggestion about respotting balls in snooker and not long after it was added to the game as an option"

The game can be challenging and it's fun to go through championships going through tougher and tougher opponents. All in all this is quickly one of my most favorite games ^^

review: Nie polecam tej gry ponieważ tryb wieloosobowy jest oszukany a dlaczego? gra jest tylko z botami! nie ma realnych graczy lecz liczyłem, że będzie możliwość aby z kimś pograć. Ponad 50 zł poszło w błoto...

author: {'steamid': '76561197991472293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1682596216}
review: When I was a kid I loved to play Cue Club it was so much fun competing with these virtual club players, unlocking new cues, ball sets etc. Cue Club 2 forgot about all this, but it's not the main reason I'm not having fun anymore in CC. After all those years playing pool in real world and seeing some other billard PC games and knowing how the balls should behave in certain situations, I feel completely dissapointed after playing Cue Club 2. Sorry but the game is far from reality, physics are just horrible. It feels like balls are heavy as steel, and the spin is so much of a disaster. When I applied backspin one of my shots, and I saw cueball just slowing mid-motion and then just moving backwards before even touching object ball I just facepalmed and turned the game off. Totally dissapointed. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198212381147', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 19510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1974, 'last_played': 1693854826}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022363817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1498987147}
review: О каком отзыве об игре может идти речь? Если управление идет через жопу. Ни на клавиатуре ни на геймпаде ( кооторый заявлен с 100% поддержкой) вам не удастся поиграть без костылей. Хочешь выбрать шар? наводи стрелку и выбирай шар( в нормальных играх для этого существуют стрелочки . Хочешь ударить с винтом или посильнее? лезь в меню на экране и там настраивай. До геймплея и всего остального я даже доходить не буду. Игра самый настоящий бдсм. Меня хватило минут на 10. Еще и ломят за игру нереальные деньги. Рублей 50 может и стоит. Только если вы готовы играть с помощью наэкранных меню.ЛОЛ. Редко пишу отзывы ,но это писец 0 из 10

review: Jestem fanem Cue Club. Niestety Cue Club 2 mnie rozczarował. Wyzwania barowe są bardzo proste. Nie ma turnieju poszczególnych klubów. Na plus zasługuje bardzo dobra fizyka, taka sama jak w poprzedniej wersji. Podsumowując zwykły bilard bez żadnych wyzwań.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119464491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 60015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15, 'playtime_at_review': 14556, 'last_played': 1712255104}
review:
I spent many hours playing first Cue Club and I was sure it's the best pool&snooker simulator we can find. But later I found this one on Steam.

What else can I say? Graphics is very nice. Music is cool too. I think that the physics is one of the strongest points of the game. We can feel like we were potting balls on the real table, with full control of the cue ball. We have a possibility to adjust the gameplay, in almost every aspect. Snooker on the blue table? Why not. Balls are too fast? You can try changing table speed. Every match can be different, if we want. And maybe the most important point - the game is dynamically changing. We have regular updates, which means we have more and more content, some bugs or errors quickly disappears. Bulldog Interactive makes really great work.

I can recommend this game to everyone who likes playing pool or snooker. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292050975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1936, 'last_played': 1708059908}
review: 击球的物理特效做得很逼真，比起QQ桌球像瓷砖式的台桌，这个桌子的阻尼系数更 高；并且不像QQ桌球上有很多反人类的进球，当然这个台子的斯诺克进球也更难，瞄准球的时候得格外格外集中精力；最高难度的选手基本上不能给对方一点机会，一个事物就成了奥沙利文，单杆最少妥妥30分；而简单模式的AI有太傻了，很多球在袋口故意乱打不仅，希望ＡＩ系统可以改进一些就好了　，另外要是丰富多人在线的话，可玩性就更高，目前基本上多人游戏匹配不到人；总体来说是一款很尊重牛顿力学的桌球游戏次

author: {'steamid': '76561198002170172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1496669110}
review:
Eine sehr gute Billiard-/Pool-/Snooker-Simulation. 
Meiner Meinung nach funktioniert das Spiel super & besticht durch seine gute Physik-Berechnung. 
Mit der "Virtuellen Spielball - Pool - Technik" funktioniert das Zielen einwandfrei. 
(Man stellt sich vor wo die weiße Kugel nach dem Stoß seien würde wenn sie genau, an der zu spielenden, Kugel angekommen wäre & angrenzt - dazu dient nämlich der Kreis auf der Zielmarkierung ingame - man kann ihn verschieben. Nun bildet man von "Zielmarkierungs-Kreis " zu "anzuspielender Kugel-Mitte" eine Linie. Schon weiß man wo die Kugel hinrollt). 

Ich kann dieses Spiel uneingeschränkt empfehlen & wünsche Euch viel Spaß damit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334999962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1536209521}
review:
ONE OF THE GREAT GAMES!
I first discovered ‘Cue Club’ about twenty years, by pure chance when I was wandering about the net, looking for a good game to play – any sort of game, just something to pass a bit of time. Well, as luck would have it, one of the apps I found was this snooker game, called Cue Club, which looked mildly interesting, so I downloaded it, just to give it a go. My thoughts were, (as a regular league snooker player myself), something like, ‘I suppose this will be a bit crass and totally unlike the real game, but it might be a bit of fun for a few minutes’. 
How wrong I was! Right from the very first I was impressed with the graphics employed, very realistic and with accurate reactions between the cue and the balls, just as had been claimed in the ‘splurge’ supplied; something to do with quantum math or something – it was so long ago I can’t recall the actual details. I also had complete control over things like colour of table top, type of cues and even the games themselves, because it wasn’t just snooker, but a whole list of other pool games as well. That first attempt provided me with more fun on the computer than I had enjoyed for a very long time.
As I said at the start, this all happened about twenty years ago, and I have been a ‘hooked’ player ever since, indulging several times a week, usually against the computer, but also occasionally against friends of mine, (because that’s one of the things you CAN do with this game!).
I’d always been impressed at the accuracy and realism of the game, and thought it had just about reached the limit, as far as that was concerned – until, that is Bulldog Interactive brought out the next generation, just a few months ago. This has had several improvements and alterations made to it, such as being designed to fit modern wide computer screens and better layout of game information, etc.
And so, the fun starts all over again – it’s just like having been promoted into a higher league! I would recommend anyone who enjoys snooker on the real tables, to give this game a go; I don’t think you’ll be disappointed! I should add that I have nothing whatsoever to do with Bulldog, I’m just a very happy customer who wanted to let the world know that there is fun to be had, and at a very reasonable price!


Brian Lee

review: This really is a great pool sim, but I still suck at it. Very simple yet has a lot of modes and challenges andoptions for rule variations. I really want to play this more, but I don't know if it's the controls, game of billiards itself, or just me, but it seems much harder than it should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167495842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1484329753}
review:
This game is visually stunning and wanted to like this game however due to it's lack of Steam Controller support I was unable to play it.

Please be aware that this game states "Full Controller Support" however here is what is listed about controller support from Bulldog:

[I]Cue Club 2 now has gamepad support for up to 2 players. Currently they must be XInput compatible controllers, although Steam controller support is under consideration (please feed back to us on this). Refer to the 'Input Methods' page from the 'Reference' menu for instructions. Also please note that controller support requires Windows 8 or above.[/I]

If you are mouse and keyboard player then you should have no issues.

Overall I think this has the potential to be a great game once full controller support (including steam( has been added)

author: {'steamid': '76561198203057435', 'num_games_owned': 1569, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1584519166}
review: As a kid I loved the original Cue Club. I was searching steam for the original and was excited to see a 2016 sequel. Who woulda thought? My only problem with the game itself so far is the lack of the smoke and lights. They were absolutely stunning in the original cue club, and would love for it to be added into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052037486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482848275}
review: Игра годная, но своей цены не стоит. Я купил за почти 400 рублей по скидке и все равно жалею потраченных денег. Очень убого сделаные карикатурные персонажи, плохая музыка - как будь-то это не полновесная игра за деньги, а браузерка и на тебя вот-вот вылезет реклама. Однако я искал полновесную замену старому дендевскому Side Pocket и я её нашел, так что возвращать не буду. Ставлю дислайк, но когда увидите эту игру за менее чем 200 рублей, то не обращайте на мой коммент внимания, но 650 это не стоит. В остальном можно играть с джойстика вдвоем, нет ужасных замут с камерой и есть девяточка. 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054211992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1626529630}
review: nostalgia 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198154766514', 'num_games_owned': 1832, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1594020541}
review: 看到有人误解这代和1代相比操作差别很大所以着急先说一下重拾1代感觉两个快捷键：首先按着鼠标左键不松开就可以和一代一样选择击球位置，另外右键可以直接击球而不用点击那个play按钮。玩过一代，国内叫桌球大师还是什么，记得当时还是4比3的画面，消磨无聊的利器，花了不少时间在上面。2代继承了1代主要优点：菜单简洁明了，操作较容易，玩法类型多样……虽然现在桌球游戏很多，也有模拟第一人称视角的，但是这个只有100多M的游戏却一点不输它们。没有中文是小小的遗憾，虽然基本都懂但还是希望能加入本地语言。

author: {'steamid': '76561197979884070', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1653094062}
review:
I used to play the original Cue Club, but it suffered from a horrendous mouse lag problem on newer OS. I didn't think I see the likes of that pool game again..

Finally, we have a much needed up to date, second game on Steam [i](even though it was released 2014, retail)[/i] It's much more polished and refined this time around. There are plenty of modes and custom content to keep you busy. 

Another welcome relief are the Devs. Always on hand to help and open to suggestions [i](They have added a few of mine, yay)[/i] however trivial you may think they are. What a great bunch :D

Cue Club 2 is one of those games where you can relax and just get on with what you want to do..play pool. No drab, static, lifeless 3D rooms, with as much life in them as a graveyard, just top down, cue out and down to business.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961284241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 46, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1712213820}
review: I owned better pool games 15 yrs ago.  However this does look very good from a top down view only.  The physics are great and the mechanics are great.  But the only top down does put a damper on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037662502', 'num_games_owned': 1438, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1632556055}
review:
A game of strategy and skill. The top down persepective is what makes it, with a simple interface that allows you to control every aspect of the shot without any hassle. 

It is relaxing and fun.

A first-person camera would be too involved and needlessly complicate the control scheme and take-away from the most enjoyable elements. Yet this game has a nice crisp and elegant presentation, with many options for the appearance of the table etc.
I have played this more than any other pool game I have for these reasons; simple to put on some music or a podcast and play this game. 

Certainly the best Pool Game I know of by far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139158591', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 4364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1695390225}
review:
This game oozes polish, from the beautiful presentation to the fine detail in gameplay.  I haven't played multiplayer yet, but can vouch for the single player game. The AI difficulty - often a complaint of mine in other pool/snooker games - scales perfectly in Cue Club 2, and each opponent has a unique character that brings life to the game with comments such as "Unlucky!" and "Cool shot!". 

The game is jam packed with modes, too,... heck, I'm 13 hours in and have still only played 6-red snooker. And the music, oh wow, the music is really, really good. 

Having played similar games, I think Cue Club 2 stands out as one of the better pool/snooker games on Steam. It's definitely a must have for fans of the sport.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000537256', 'num_games_owned': 11253, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1469221136}
review:
Cue Club 2: Pool and Snooker is the sequel to the original Cue Club game which was released in 2000 by Bulldog Interactive. It’s a game which features many game modes related to pool and snooker. This game improves almost everything from the first game but on the other hand also skips on somethings that were available in the first Cue Club. Now, for me it was one of the best childhood memories. playing those Cue Club virtual tournaments and trying to beat the AI in the game and virtual chatting with the AI. Such nostalgia.

 [h1]Graphics:[/h1]

The game looks absolutely beautiful. The graphics are clean and detailed.  It’s a top down snooker/pool game and this type of art-style looks very good for it. The art-style is very similar to the first game but in this one is HD and it’s much more polished and has more eye candy. Some of the effect that were included in the first game seem to be missing, namely the strobing disco light effect. The game is locked at 60 FPS and I did not get any dips in performance throughout my gameplay.

[h1]Sound:[/h1]

Cue Club 2 features very awesome soundtracks. These soundtracks, I can listen to them all day long. It’s sort of like club music but a bit slower paced. The sound of the cues, balls hitting other balls, even chalking your cue are good. Just listen to the music in the video posted below.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]

The gameplay is pretty simple and straight forward. The good part is the variety of things you can do. You can play 8 ball pool, 9 ball pool, 6 ball pool, killer pool, full snooker or 10 and 6 balls snookers. You can play against the AI or play 2 players locally taking turns each. The physics of the table cloth can be adjusted and the size of the balls can also be changed. The game’s physics is one of the best pool physics in a pool game I have seen. The AI opponents will say stuff like “nice shot” if you manage a good shot, which can be pretty entertaining. Another thing missing is the virtual chat option. That was one of the prominent features of the game and highly entertaining. As you could get in chats with the AI players and mess around.

There are tons of design choices you can select for almost everything in the game. You can change the table cloth color, the finish of the wood, the pattern on the table cloth. The balls size can be adjusted and plenty of different types of balls can be selected. You can even choose the color of your chalk. Many different types of cues are available as well. Even some match rules can be changed. All of these are unlocked and ready to use, so no more grinding to unlock these cosmetic items.

You can play different modes such as a tournament mode where you and several other virtual AI opponents will enter and there are fixtures just like a real snooker/pool tournament. Other than that there’s also bar mode where you start off in the lowest basement level bar and make your way up to a more expensive penthouse bar. The difficulty will increase as you progress to higher level bars. You can play solo as well. You can also play quick mode where you can just go and play any type of game with AI opponent. Another mode is solo mode. This has a game type called “Slam”. In this you can drag the cue ball with your mouse as if it were attached with a string and play that way. This mode was pretty fun. Other solo game types include speed pool mode where you have to clear the table as fast as you can and that time is recorded so you can come back and try to beat your own time. 

A short gameplay video of a bar challenge game can be found below:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=729525708

1) Stay away
2) Not Recommended
3) Only recommended when on sale
4) Recommended 
[b][u]5) Highly recommended[/u][/b]
6) This is a must play

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]

If you have played the original Cue Club back in the day, you’re in for a pleasant surprise with this game. Even if you haven’t played it, this game is so amazing. One of the best pool/snooker games I have ever played. Super addicting, gorgeous with an amazing sound track. If you like pool/snooker in real life or in games media, then this is the game for you. The game has some nice achievements too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071796481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 4593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3111, 'last_played': 1700659636}
review:
找童年系列...满满的都是情怀啊.....T_T

---------------17.06.28---------------
游戏直到昨天还在继续更新，目前有了3D视角，
而且做得很棒，无论光影还是声效，
都比别的一众台球游戏更加真实和出色，
很有质感。
目前击球线路提示也可以自己设置了，
默认是没有开启的。
按住右键调整击球力量，
右键按住的时候同时按下左键可取消该次击球，
这个功能更新好久了，还是写出来吧，
给新入的朋友参考一下，
基本上这个游戏左右俩键就全控制了。

真的是个用心的作品。推荐。

---------------16.10.05---------------
经过两次反馈，一两个小bug都被修复了，
建议增加的练习模式还原上次击球的功能也在第二天就更新了，
开发者的反馈很迅速，好评！

---------------16.09.15---------------
看到有说操作麻烦得来回点的什么的，
明明右键就能直接击球了呀，
选择个力度和击球点应该很合理吧....
这代除了酒吧里没那么多AI跟你bb了，
别的哪儿跟上一代变化太大了...
现在联机模式也上线了，虽然我网不好T_T
不过即使打AI也挺好玩的啊，
（真的很推荐）* 10086。

review: Игра хорошая,  но есть НО. Как и в прошлых версиях нет повтора удара при выходе из снукера с фолом с той же позиции. При использовании мыши нет управления мелом (только автомат). Нет сигнализации о необходимости снукеров.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126550070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 16772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9147, 'last_played': 1619894466}
review:
Сразу скажу, что я не новичок в игре на бильярде (и в реальной, и в виртуальной). Первый обзор на игру был больше негативным, но кое-что подправлено апдейтами. Поэтому скорректирую... 

Плюсы:

1. Визуально игра звёзд с неба не хватает, однако марку держит. Вид сверху однообразен, но для многих игр данного жанра привычен. Лично я бы хотел иметь вариативность в этой части. Есть несколько фенечек вроде выбора кия, шаров, стола и т.п., мел оставляет след на сукне. В целом терпимо, но можно лучше.

2. "Физика" шаров на уровне без вопросов. Придраться не к чему.

3. Есть несколько уровней сложности, тренировочный режим, присутствуют интересные варианты пула (кроме обычных 8-ки и 9-ки). Порадовало наличие снукера. Не порадовало отсутствие стрейт пула. Не помешали бы дополнительные настройки в матчевой игре. Например, настройки количества партий, шаров и т.п. до победы.

Минусы:

1. Самая большой хренью этой игры (сорри за мой французский) был абсолютный дисбаланс искусственного интеллекта, особенно на высоких уровнях сложности. На начальных уровнях оппонент едва бил в сторону лузы, на уровне профи - не знал, как промахнуться. Причём забитие происходило из самых странных положений. ИИ мог со всей дури ударить в скопление из, допустим, пяти шаров и с кучей рикошетов нужный шарик падал в итоге в лузу. И это норма. Я уж не говорю про "открытые" удары, и использование бортов с любого расстояния и на любой резке. Попадание было 100%, даже не 99... Переход хода был реален только при "слипшихся" шарах либо биток случайно упал в лузу. Остальное - статистическая погрешность. По факту снукер сильно проседал. Выигрывать партию с кия в пуле можно, в снукере - это бред, даже для профессионала. 

Эту проблему слегка пофиксили. Играть стало менее напряжно, но трикшоты ИИ всё равно"проскакивают".

2. Игра однозначно заточена под пул. Снукер обделён. Во-первых, над ИИ в части снукера еще стоит поработать. Лично я не хотел бы видеть трюкачество в снукере в качестве нормы. Во-вторых, в снукере по-прежнему не реализована часть важных правил. Например, отсутствует так назывемый Foul and a Miss (Фол и Промах). Хотя в некоторых ситуациях прям напрашивается. То есть позиция снукера при неудачном выходе из него никогда не восстанавливается. После удара можно либо продолжать самому, либо дать продолжить противнику. Что удручает, ведь порой грамотным снукером можно  до смерти затерзать оппонента, но увы не здесь...( Есть и другие неточности в реализации правил игры в снукер.

3. Музыка в игре, что есть, что нет. Выключил почти сразу, чтоб не напрягала. Но это болезнь практически любых симуляторов бильярда.

4. Заявленная цена великовата для "сырой" в целом игры. Приличный мультиплеер, пусть и локальный, мог бы хоть как-то её оправдать)

Итог. Довольно попсовенький бильярд с несколько завышенной ценой. Можно поиграть в своё удовольствие в свободное время, если при этом поставить фоном свою музыку и не жаль копеечку. Пожалуй, 7 из 10 с перспективой 8-ми.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139692899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1459988546}
review:
I own the original Cue Club, and I once thought it was the best pool game ever made. I dunno whether it still is, perhaps it's tied with it's sequel.

The original Cue Club had plenty of games including Killer Pool and a few other fun options for party play. I'm glad they're all here in Cue Club 2. I also love the fact that you have every aesthetic option available from the beginning, unlike the original in which you had to unlock things mighty slowly.

There were several features now missing in Cue Club 2. Some were quite fun, such as disco lights, strobe, and "dynamic" cue play. Of all of these I miss it's the "dynamic" cue play, as it made the mouse become the friggin' cue. No such feature here. A feature that some might miss from the original is the "chat" feature, but that had too many flaws for me to work it out. I'm glad it's refined so the computer actually feels more human. Pretty cool.

OK, now that I've gotten an old vet's fit out of the way, it's time to put the olive branch where it belongs. Cue Club 2 is well worth your money if you're looking for a pool game. The music makes you feel like you're in a club, which is awesome. The physics are as equivalent to real life as humanly possible, and the visuals can fool you into thinking you're playing the real thing. You actually click the chalk block in order to chalk your cue, in contrast to a command in the original. In my opinion, Cue Club 2 is the very closest you can get to playing a real pool game on a computer.

Would I recommend this over the original? No, I wouldn't. But does that mean I want you to have the original instead? You're silly if you didn't see the fact that I think this game's worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082899615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1710504081}
review: Vamos, es cue club, si te gustaba el original, que pase horas recuerdo en mi pentium con windows 98 viciando, como no tener CC2 HD. El juego tiene dos tipos de tiros, automatico como se ve en los videos, o manual que es parecido al tiro de otros juegos de pool de la actualidad, Mucho contenido en cuanto a tacos, colores de mesas, bolas, todo es personalizable y se ve de maravilla con esta version HD, los torneos son excelentes (quien no quiere ganarle una partida a un gorila, sisi un gorila en un torneo de bola 8 xD) su dificultad es moderada pero a medida que avanzamos cada vez se hace mas complicado, sigue teniendo esa quimica del CC original lo que es un punto muy positivo. Como punto a tener en cuenta es que no tiene multiplayer (de momento), eso podrian mejorar. El juego es suave al manejar cada tiro, las fisicas de las bolas son realistas, en fin, muy bueno y divertido, eso es lo importante. Lo recomiendo para todos los amantes del pool clasico, si te gustaba Cue Club, este te va a encantar.
